name: Wreaking Havok Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Alex and Scott were seperated from their parents when an alien craft attacked their airplane. The brothers ended up in an orphanage in which state?
questions.explanation:
Nebraska.

	The orphanage was situated in Omaha, Nebraska and run by the evil mutant known as Mister Sinister! In time, Alex was adopted by a family and was seperated from Scott. These events happened in "Uncanny X-Men" #156, which debuted in 1982.

questions.text: What was the last name of Alex's foster family?
questions.explanation:
Blanding.

	The Blanding family constantly tried to make Alex fit the image of their son Todd, who died in a car crash. Alex 's powers manifested for the first time when the man who killed Todd kidnapped Alex and Haley, his foster sister. These events happened in the special issue of "X-Factor Minus One", debuting in 1997.

questions.text: What did Alex study in college?
questions.explanation:
Geophysics.

	Upon his graduation, Alex was surprised to get a visit from his brother Scott and the rest of the X-Men. He was even more surprised to be kidnapped by the Living Pharaoh! He wanted Alex's power, and eventually became the Living Monolith. These events happened in issues 54-56 of "Uncanny X-Men", which debuted in 1969.

questions.text: As Havok, Alex had a hard time controlling his power. A fight with this other superpowered individual helped him control his powers.
questions.explanation:
The Hulk.

	After accidentally injuring Iceman with his powers, Havok quit the X-Men and isolated himself. Professor Xavier asked Lorna Dane to find Havok, and the search led to the desert and to the Hulk! Battling to save Lorna, Havok was able to focus his power into one tight beam. These events happened in "The Incredible Hulk" #150, which debuted in 1972.

questions.text: After many battles alongside the X-Men, Alex decided it was time for a vacation. Where did he and Wolverine travel to?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	The duo's luck ran out, as they ran afoul of Meltdown! The evil scientist used Alex as a pawn and was able to absorb his energy blasts to become stronger! Wolverine was able to stop the process in time, and Alex redirected the now-deadly energy into outer space. These events happened in the miniseries "Havok and Wolverine: Meltdown", debuting in 1988.

questions.text: When Havok joins X-Factor, who is NOT a member of the team?
questions.explanation:
Quicksilver.

	Havok joins the team in issue #71, which debuted in 1991. Although Quicksilver is in the issue, as his power has made his aging accelerate, he is not a member of the team. At the end of the issue, it appears that Multiple Man has been shot.

questions.text: In an alternate timeline, Alex led The Six. Who was not a member of the team?
questions.explanation:
Colossus.

	The Fallen was an alternate version of Archangel, Brute was an alternate version of Beast, and Bloodstorm was an alternate version of Storm. Havok's mind was transported here during an explosion, and he found himself the leader of this team! These events happened in the first issue of "Mutant X", which debuted in 1998.

questions.text: Havok began a romance with Annie, a nurse who had helped him when he was comatose. What secret did she hide?
options: She was a spy from HYDRA
questions.explanation:
Her son was a mutant.

	Annie's son Carter had telepathic and telekinetic abilities. He made Annie and Havok fall in love, even though the latter was nothing more than a comatose patient at the time. Carter first appeared in "Uncanny X-Men" #411, which went on sale in 2002.

questions.text: Havok was recruited by Professor X to go on a mission to stop Vulcan. Who of the following was NOT on the same team?
questions.explanation:
Gambit.

	In the 475th issue of "Uncanny X-Men", Professor X assembled a strike force to defeat Vulcan, the brother of Havok and Cyclops, and keep him from destroying the Shi'ar empire. The team consisted of Darwin, Havok, Marvel Girl, Nightcrawler, Warpath, and Polaris. The issue went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: After Corsair's death, Havok joins the Starjammers. Who else joins?
questions.explanation:
Marvel Girl.

	Both Polaris and Marvel Girl join the Starjammers, whose goals are to defeat Vulcan and restore Princess Lilandra to the Shi'ar throne. Havok's father Corsair led the Starjammers for a number of years, but he was killed by Vulcan, his wayward son and Havok's brother. Havok enlisted in the group in the miniseries "X-Men: Emperor Vulcan", which debuted in 2007.
